greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of partitions of binomial(n,k) into parts greater than k and not greater than n, 0<=k<=n.
link: Index entries for triangles and arrays related to Pascal's triangle
example: T(6,2) = #{partitions of binomial(6,2)=15 into parts i with 2<i<=6}
T(6,3) = #{partitions of binomial(6,3)=20 into parts i with 3<i<=6}
program: p ks'@(k:ks) m = if m < k then 0 else p ks' (m - k) + p ks m
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 16 2004
ext: Offset and example corrected by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 10 2012
